# Bar plots

## Simple bar plot

This is a simple bar plot^[Or maybe it's not that simple after all.].

```{r}
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = class)) +
  geom_bar(alpha = .75) +
  scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p, tooltip = "x")
```

## Stacked bar plots

Stacked bar plots can be used to add additional information to a bar plot.

::: {.foldable}
Hello **world**!
:::

Apparently, bs4_book comes with a callout block out of the box, let's check it out:

::: {.rmdnote}

The `bs4_book` style also includes an `.rmdnote` callout block
like this one.

```{r collapse=TRUE}
head(beaver1, n = 5)
```
:::

The following graph is a stacked bar plot.

```{r}
p <- ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, fill = drv)) +
  geom_bar(alpha = .75) +
  scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE, option = "mako", end = .95) +
  theme_rethink()

ggplotly(p)
```
